info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 650 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Hardeeville, or 10 miles northwest of Bluffton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Bluffton, Jasper, Hardeeville, Calawassie Island, Pritchardville, Lemon Island, Rose Hill, and Sun City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
